definition: fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: Oft shall the pilgrim lift the latch.
sentences.chinese: 香客將常啓開我門的門閂。

sentences.english: Worshippers burn offerings on the fifth day of the Chinese Lunar New Year at Guiyuan Buddhist Temple in Wuhan, China.
sentences.chinese: 農曆新年初五武漢歸元寺擠滿了供香的香客，中國。

sentences.english: Annual number of pilgrims and swirling smoke.
sentences.chinese: 常年香客不斷，煙雲繚繞。

sentences.english: Pilgrims who generally seek the extraordinary, had found too much of it.
sentences.chinese: 那些總想尋幽探奇的香客，發現這裏景色太奇新了。

sentences.english: Worshipers flock there, and so do many tourists and sightseers.
sentences.chinese: 香客雲集，還有許多遊客。

sentences.english: Many pilgrims make a visit to the Kek Lok Si on Penang island to pray for good luck.
sentences.chinese: 很多香客會拜訪檳城島上的極樂寺求好運氣。

sentences.english: ROMEO Have not saints lips, and holy palmers too?
sentences.chinese: 羅密歐聖徒與香客難道沒有嘴脣？

sentences.english: As the ancestral temple, every day a quantity of believers come there.
sentences.chinese: 作爲祖廟，每天來此朝拜媽祖的香客非常多。

sentences.english: He shaved his head, wore a priestly robe and carried a pilgrim's staff.
sentences.chinese: 他剃了頭，穿上僧袍，拄着香客用的柺杖。

sentences.english: Ancient pilgrims, tourists are now on this street there are impressive.
sentences.chinese: 古代的香客，現在的遊人都對這條街存有深刻的印象。

sentences.english: This group of pilgrims poured into Wuzhen much a catalyst for a local incense city.
sentences.chinese: 這批香客湧進烏鎮，大大催化了當地的香市。

sentences.english: Callaghan knows all about gifted tacticians wrestling control of the club having been at Anfield during Shankly's reign.
sentences.chinese: 卡拉漢知道所有香客利執掌俱樂部手腕與技巧。

sentences.english: In front of the temple it's again full of pilgrims and devotees.
sentences.chinese: 一如既往，寺廟前到處都是朝聖者和虔誠的香客。

definition: to burn incense at a temple
to go on a pilgrimage and offer incense (idiom)
to burn incense and worship Buddha
